title: lol
content:
The first time I ever played Keen1, I remember saying "Oh, wow, that level looks like the Technodrome!" (from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)
When playing many Keen2 levels, I said "Oh, wow, that's a lot of Elites..."
When playing Keen3, I said "Wow, is this even possible?"

:-) Most games I play will elicit a "Wow" from me, but that's because I'm very easily immersed in the gameplay. I've stopped and just stared at games sometimes, just trying to imagine what the concept art looked like, or how it must have felt to design it. *shrug* Wow.

--Xky

title: Re: lol
content:
Where does Keen 1 resemble the Technodrome?
I looked it up on Google, and I was thinking about the right thing, but... the insides, the external, the technical look...???Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Re: lol
content:
the biggest happiest moment for me was when i finnaly got hold of keen5 after a looong period of time.

i rememebr i used to love keen5(still do) and use to always play it on my old computer (386) but my old computer broke, i cant remember what was wrong with it, i think it was a error on the hard drive or somthing. and so, i didnt play keen5 for maybe 5 or 6 years [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] then finally i was so desperate for keen 5, i couldnt take it anymore, i opened up my 386 and started unplugging all the wires inside and plugging them back in, and finally after like maybe 3 hours i got it to start properly, and then i got a floppy and put keen 5 on the new computer and played it[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] it was so amazing, seeing all my favourite levels again, especially since i forgot 60% of the levels which were in the game, i brang so many memories. i played and finished keen 5 twice in the one day on hard without saving [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-love.gif[/img] ----------------------
LEX says: Goodbye

title: Re: technodrome
content:
"is that supposed to be a turtle? because i thought it was a turtle too "

I never knew what those domes were, but then i realized they were domes. It took me a while to realize that level 16 was a castle. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

What makes me say "Wow"?

Well, when i first found Korath III Base, I was surprised by the bagpipe music and the looooong fall.
Also when i found a secret elevator in keen 5.
And when the foot appeared.
And when keen mooned me.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-moon.gif[/img]
And when i found out the GOD cheat and didn't know what happened.
And when that rock fell on the Vorticon Commander.
And probably lots more...[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: technodrome
content:
They're not dome-shaped but cillinder-shaped if you ask me, with some extra, smaller buildings connected to them.
The top connected building has some darker pixels which made it resemble a face to me.
(Considering there's a whole portion of the brain dedicated to recognising faces that isn't particularly surprising.)
That would mean the guy was on his back though, which doesn't make much sense for a turtle.
Anyway, I'm pretty sure he wasn't saying it resembled a turtle, just the Technodrome. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Wow
content:
Yeah, seeing Arachnuts for the first time (and a few times after) illicited a wow type response. Seeing all the teddy bears at the end of secret level episode 1. Seeing the impossible stairs to the 6 teddy bears on episode 1. Finally getting the 6 teddybears on episode 1. How I felt when I found the secret level on episode 1 in response to how you have to get there (ride ice cube over wall) Prolly others, but can't think of them - been so long since the games were so fresh as to illicit wow like response.

Being impressed by some stuff in Xky's keen 1 mod, including but not limited to the train of two eyed green things at the end of the penultimate level. Btw, Xky, been playing your episode 2 mod, but don't enjoy it half as much as your ep 1 to be honest. It is growing on me, though, but all the black ninja rifle dudes really get me sour and the super fast ghost skeliton things are annoying me less as time goes on but still annoying. Too many unpredictable elements in the game now. Just causes lots of frustration. The artwork is decent, if not better than your first mod. Wish there were some secrets in the levels. Lots of secrets are what make a game have good replayability. Episode 4 I played sooo much just so I could find all the secrets. Prolly still haven't found em all.

Sorry for going off topic.

title: Re: Wow
content:
another wow: when saving Paris in Xky's Keen2mod you have to jump on this block that has things going around it so you have to jump up and down so as to not get knocked off then you have to watch your head because of the firing robot looming above - then you have to pogo jump across the screen without hitting him - then you have to do it all over again once you get the key! But it was a real thrill - so a general wow to the extent that Xky is able to make sensational levels. Now if only he made secret levels, I'd be in commander keen bliss.

More wow - several times I had some real close scrapes with death during my stint to save Paris. Funny how a game from 1992 provides more thrill, excitement and adventure than any newfangled nonsense put out by large conglomerate game makers. Wow.

title: Re: Wow
content:
"another wow: when saving Paris in Xky's Keen2mod you have to jump on this block that has things going around it"

I believe those "things" were containers of Narln food.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

Not to go too far off topic, but you shouldn't be saving "Paris" in XkyKeen2... you should be passing the "Final" test (if I remember correctly...) Are you making sure to run things with ck2patch? :-P Or at least run the XkyKeen2.bat file?

And they never really had a name... I just called 'em "Tubs."

--Xky

title: Re: ?!
content:
Ohhh... that explains it. Well, yeah, that level was much harder than the others and more like a final level compared to the others.

I ran the .bat file to play it. I'll try running the patch.

title: Re: ?!
content: The .bat file runs the patch. What you shouldn't be doing is running KEEN2.EXE directly (i.e double-clicking it)
